original: Adler, Herbert Gustaf-Adolf, praktiserande läkare, AUngsås, f. 16/12/09 i Jönköping av Adolf A. o. Elisabet KuHin. G. 38 m. Kerstin Ljungkvist. Barn: Jan-Olof f. 39, Hans-Lennart 44. — Stud:ex. i Jönköping 28, med. kand. 32 o. med. lic. 38 i Lund. För-ordn. som und :läk. v. Kisa las., kortare tider v. Sjö-Gunnarsbo sanat. o. v. Karlskrona las. med. avd. samt som stadsläk. i Skänninge 38, assist :-läk. o. tf. und :läk. v. Alingsås las. 39, andre und:läk. 40-43, tf. andre und:-läk. v. med. avd. å las. i Vänersborg 43, und:läk. v. röntgenavd. där 44, därunder tf. överläk. tre mån., prakt, läk. i Alingsås sed. 44.
translated: Adler, Herbert Gustaf-Adolf, practicing physician, AUngsås, born on December 16, 1909 in Jönköping to parents Adolf A. and Elisabet KuHin. Married in 1938 to Kerstin Ljungkvist, with children Jan-Olof born in 1939 and Hans-Lennart born in 1944. He received his high school degree in Jönköping in 1928, his Bachelor of Medicine in 1932, and his medical license in 1938 from Lund University. He served as an assistant physician at Kisa Hospital, briefly at Sjö-Gunnarsbo Sanatorium and Karlskrona Hospital, and as a municipal physician in Skänninge in 1938. He also worked as an assistant and temporary assistant physician at Alingsås Hospital from 1939 to 1943, and as a temporary assistant physician in the medical department of Vänersborg Hospital in 1943. In 1944, he became a physician at Alingsås Hospital where he remained until his retirement.
